title: üß† NFT Lingo Decoded
description: Master the language of NFT Twitter and Web3 culture. Learn to speak like a true degen and decode the hidden meanings behind NFT slang.

modules.title: Module 1: Speak Like a Degen
modules.description: Welcome to the world of NFTs, where the memes are strong and the lingo is stronger. In this module, we'll decode everyday NFT slang‚Äîlike 'WAGMI', 'rug', 'paper hands', and more. Get ready to talk the talk.

lessons.title: Translate the Tweet
lessons.content:
Break down this tweet: 'Just swept 6 rank 100s under .03‚Äîvibes immaculate. WAGMI frfr.' 

Explain what each part means in plain English:

- 'swept 6 rank 100s': Bought 6 NFTs with rank 100 (rarity)
- 'under .03': For less than 0.03 SOL each
- 'vibes immaculate': The feeling is perfect
- 'WAGMI frfr': We're All Gonna Make It, for real for real

This tweet shows someone buying multiple rare NFTs at a good price and feeling optimistic about the project.

modules.title: Module 2: Floor Price Mechanics
modules.description: Terms like 'undercut', 'thin floor', and 'sweeping' describe how NFTs move on marketplaces. We'll explain how flippers operate, what a 'floor' really is, and why some people get mad when it drops.

lessons.title: Thin Floor Simulation
lessons.content:
Given a fictional NFT collection, simulate a thin floor scenario and explain how undercutting affects price action. Use at least 3 mock listings.

**Scenario:** WifHoodie collection with thin floor

**Current Listings:**
- Hoodie #123: 2.5 SOL
- Hoodie #456: 2.4 SOL (undercut)
- Hoodie #789: 2.3 SOL (undercut)

**What happens:**
1. Floor drops from 2.5 to 2.3 SOL
2. Other holders panic and list lower
3. Floor continues dropping
4. Creates selling pressure

**Key lesson:** Undercutting can trigger a cascade of lower listings.

modules.title: Module 3: Trait Meta + Rankings
modules.description: What does 'Rank 4' mean? And why does it matter? This module introduces rarity ranking, metadata sorting, and how it impacts buying decisions.

lessons.title: Rank Reveal
lessons.content:
Pick one WifHoodie or similar NFT project. Identify the traits of a top-10 ranked NFT and explain why its rank might influence buyer behavior.

**Example Analysis:**

**WifHoodie #42 (Rank 4)**
- **Traits:** Gold Hoodie, Diamond Eyes, Crown
- **Rarity:** Extremely rare combination
- **Value:** Commands premium price
- **Demand:** High from collectors

**Why Rank Matters:**
- Rarity drives value
- Collectors pay premiums
- Trading volume higher
- Price stability better

**Buyer Behavior:**
- Willing to pay 5-10x floor
- Hold for longer periods
- Less likely to panic sell
- More strategic trading

modules.title: Module 4: Red Flags & Exit Signals
modules.description: Not all hype is healthy. Learn to spot 10 common red flags in NFT communities‚Äîfrom fake sweep bots to influencer exit pumps.

lessons.title: Signal Scanner
lessons.content:
List 5 red flags you've personally seen in a hyped project. Briefly explain how each one should've been a signal to stay out or take profits.

**Common Red Flags:**

1. **'This is the next BAYC'**
   - Why suspicious: Overly ambitious claims
   - Signal: Stay out, unrealistic expectations

2. **Team is 'doxxed' but no proof**
   - Why suspicious: Easy to fake
   - Signal: Verify identities before investing

3. **'Moon soon' with no catalyst**
   - Why suspicious: Vague promises
   - Signal: Look for specific roadmaps

4. **Influencers suddenly pumping**
   - Why suspicious: Often exit strategy
   - Signal: Take profits, don't FOMO

5. **Community attacking critics**
   - Why suspicious: Suppressing dissent
   - Signal: Unhealthy community, exit

completionText: ‚úÖ You now speak fluent JPEG. From lingo to liquidation traps, you're one step closer to decoding every chart and community meme like a pro.
